Step:5 Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band reverse fly
instructions: Step:1 Attach the band to a stationary object at chest height.
Step:2 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands in front of you.
Step:3 Keep your arms straight and lift them out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Step:5 Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell incline press on exercise ball
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an exercise ball with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
Step:2 Slowly walk your feet forward, rolling your body down the ball until your head, neck, and back are supported on the ball.
Step:3 Hold the dumbbells at shoulder level, elbows bent and pointing out to the sides.
Step:4 Press the dumbbells upward, extending your arms fully.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell side split squat v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
Step:2 Hold a barbell across your back, resting it on your shoulders.
Step:3 Take a big step to the side with your right foot, keeping your left foot planted.
Step:4 Bend your right knee and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your chest up and your back straight.
Step:5 Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat on the other side, stepping out with your left foot.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable standing twist row (v-bar)
instructions: Step:1 Attach a v-bar attachment to a cable machine at chest height.
Step:2 Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step:4 Take a step back to create tension in the cable.
Step:5 Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the exercise.
Step:6 Pull the v-bar towards your torso by retracting your shoulder blades and bending your elbows.
Step:7 As you pull, twist your torso to one side, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:8 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, feeling the contraction in your back.
Step:9 Slowly release the tension and return to the starting position, untwisting your torso.
Step:10 Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, alternating the twisting direction with each rep.

name: smith machine incline tricep extension
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat of the smith machine so that the bar is at shoulder height.
Step:2 Sit on the bench with your back against the pad and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:3 Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Extend your arms fully, lifting the bar off the rack and holding it directly above your chest.
Step:5 Lower the bar slowly towards your forehead, keeping your elbows close to your head.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the bar back up to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dead bug
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your arms extended towards the ceiling.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lift your legs off the ground, creating a 90-degree angle at your hips and knees.
Step:3 Engage your core and lower back to press your lower back into the ground.
Step:4 Slowly lower your right arm and left leg towards the ground, keeping them straight and hovering just above the floor.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the movement with your left arm and right leg.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: olympic barbell hammer curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold an Olympic barbell with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang at arm's length in front of your thighs, with your palms facing your body.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: v-sit on floor
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Lean back slightly and lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Simultaneously, lift your upper body off the ground and reach your arms towards your legs.
Step:4 Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your upper body and legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: push up on bosu ball
instructions: Step:1 Place the bosu ball on the ground with the flat side facing up.
Step:2 Position yourself in a push-up position with your hands on the outer edges of the bosu ball.
Step:3 Engage your core and lower your body down towards the bosu ball by bending your elbows.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: side hip abduction
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips.
Step:2 Shift your weight to one leg and lift the opposite leg out to the side, keeping it straight.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat on the other side.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated hammer curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso and arms extended straight down.
Step:2 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band kneeling twisting crunch
instructions: Step:1 Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at waist height.
Step:2 Kneel down facing away from the anchor point and hold the band with both hands, keeping your elbows bent and close to your sides.
Step:3 Engage your abs and slowly twist your torso to one side, bringing your hands towards your opposite hip.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: walking on incline treadmill
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the incline level on the treadmill to your desired intensity.
Step:2 Stand on the treadmill with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Start walking at a comfortable pace, ensuring that you maintain proper form.
Step:4 Engage your core muscles and keep your back straight throughout the exercise.
Step:5 Continue walking on the incline treadmill for the desired duration of your cardio workout.
Step:6 Gradually decrease the incline and speed of the treadmill to cool down before stopping.

name: wrist rollerer
instructions: Step:1 Attach a weight to one end of a rope or bar.
Step:2 Hold the other end of the rope or bar with both hands, palms facing down.
Step:3 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms fully extended in front of you.
Step:4 Slowly roll the weight up towards your hands by flexing your wrists.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted sissy squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing slightly outward.
Step:2 Hold a weight in front of your chest with both hands, or place a barbell across your back.
Step:3 Keeping your chest up and your core engaged, slowly lower your body down by bending at the knees and hips.
Step:4 Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell step-up lunge
instructions: Step:1 Stand in front of a step or platform with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your sides.
Step:2 Place your right foot on the step, ensuring your entire foot is on the surface.
Step:3 Push through your right heel and lift your body up onto the step, bringing your left foot up as well.
Step:4 Once both feet are on the step, lower your left foot back down to the starting position, keeping your right foot on the step.
Step:5 Repeat the movement, alternating which foot you step up with each time.
Step:6 Continue for the desired number of repetitions.

name: back twist
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart.
Step:3 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:4 Engage your abs and slowly twist your torso to the right, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the end of the twist, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the twist to the left side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: seated piriformis stretch
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Bend your right knee and place your right foot on the outside of your left knee.
Step:3 Place your left elbow on the outside of your right knee and gently twist your torso to the right.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then switch sides and repeat.

name: seated wide angle pose sequence
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the ground with your legs extended in a wide angle.
Step:2 Flex your feet and engage your quads.
Step:3 Place your hands on the ground behind you for support.
Step:4 Keeping your back straight, lean forward from your hips.
Step:5 Continue leaning forward until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.
Step:6 Hold this position for a few breaths.
Step:7 Slowly release the stretch and return to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell full squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Step:2 Hold the barbell across your back, resting it on your traps or rear shoulders.
Step:3 Engage your core and keep your chest up as you begin to lower your body down.
Step:4 Bend at the knees and hips, pushing your hips back and down as if sitting into a chair.
Step:5 Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
Step:6 Keep your knees in line with your toes and your weight in your heels.
Step:7 Drive through your heels to stand back up, extending your hips and knees.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable rear delt row (stirrups)
instructions: Step:1 Attach a stirrup handle to a low cable pulley and stand facing the machine.
Step:2 Grasp the handle with your left hand and take a step back with your right foot, positioning your body at a slight angle.
Step:3 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:4 With your left arm extended and your palm facing down, pull the handle towards your chest by retracting your shoulder blade.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder blade.
Step:6 Slowly release the handle back to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Step:7 Switch sides and repeat the exercise with your right arm.

name: dumbbell arnold press
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with back support and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level, palms facing your body and elbows bent.
Step:2 Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended and your palms are facing forward.
Step:3 Rotate your wrists as you lift, so that your palms are facing forward at the top of the movement.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: l-sit on floor
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Place your hands on the floor beside your hips, fingers pointing forward.
Step:3 Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight.
Step:4 Try to bring your legs parallel to the floor, forming an 'L' shape with your body.
Step:5 Hold this position for as long as you can.
Step:6 Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: bodyweight squatting row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding onto a sturdy object or suspension trainer with your arms extended.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and your knees behind your toes.
Step:3 From the squat position, pull your body up towards the object or suspension trainer, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted round arm
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Raise your arms out to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:4 Continue lifting your arms until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lying supine curl
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing up and arms fully extended.
Step:2 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell bent arm pullover
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your head at one end and your feet on the floor.
Step:2 Hold a barbell with a shoulder-width grip and extend your arms straight above your chest.
Step:3 Lower the barbell behind your head while keeping your arms slightly bent.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then raise the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable overhead curl on exercise ball
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an exercise ball and hold the cable handle with an underhand grip.
Step:2 Extend your arms fully overhead, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
Step:3 Slowly curl the cable down towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell lying lifting (on hip)
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
Step:2 Hold the barbell with an overhand grip and position it on your hips.
Step:3 Engaging your glutes, lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band squat row
instructions: Step:1 Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at waist height.
Step:2 Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hold the band handles with your palms facing each other and your arms extended in front of you.
Step:4 Bend your knees and lower into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest lifted.
Step:5 From the squat position, pull the band handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell wide squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
Step:2 Hold the barbell across your back, resting it on your traps or rear shoulders.
Step:3 Engage your core and keep your chest up as you lower your body down into a squat, pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Step:4 Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable seated chest press
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and cable handles to a comfortable position.
Step:2 Sit on the bench with your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
Step:3 Grasp the cable handles with an overhand grip at shoulder height.
Step:4 Push the handles forward and away from your body, extending your arms fully.
Step:5 Pause for a moment, then slowly bring the handles back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: kettlebell one arm floor press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the kettlebell in one hand with your palm facing towards your feet and your arm extended straight up towards the ceiling.
Step:3 Slowly lower the kettlebell towards your chest by bending your elbow, keeping your upper arm close to your body.
Step:4 Pause for a moment when the kettlebell is just above your chest, then push it back up to the starting position by extending your elbow.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

name: dumbbell push press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and dip your body down, then explosively extend your legs and press the dumbbells overhead.
Step:3 Lock out your arms at the top of the movement, then lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith incline bench press
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the bench to a 30-45 degree incline.
Step:2 Sit on the bench with your back flat against the pad and feet firmly on the ground.
Step:3 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows slightly tucked in.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: one arm slam (with medicine ball)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the medicine ball with one hand in front of your waist.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and engage your core.
Step:3 Raise the medicine ball above your head, fully extending your arm.
Step:4 Forcefully slam the medicine ball down to the ground, using your core and shoulders to generate power.
Step:5 Catch the medicine ball on the bounce and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band lying hip internal rotation
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back with your legs straight and a resistance band looped around your feet.
Step:2 Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest, keeping your feet together.
Step:3 Slowly rotate your knees outwards, away from each other, while keeping your feet together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the end of the rotation, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: push-up
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet together.
Step:2 Engage your core and lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line.
Step:3 Pause for a moment when your chest is just above the ground, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: assisted pull-up
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height settings.
Step:2 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hang with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
Step:4 Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the handles, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:5 Continue pulling until your chin is above the handles.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: mountain climber
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Engage your core and bring your right knee towards your chest, then quickly switch and bring your left knee towards your chest.
Step:3 Continue alternating legs in a running motion, keeping your hips low and your core engaged.
Step:4 Maintain a steady pace and breathe evenly throughout the exercise.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell alternate hammer preacher curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a preacher bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso and arms fully extended.
Step:2 Keep your upper arms stationary and exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: cable incline fly
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the cable machine to a low position and attach the handles.
Step:2 Sit on an incline bench with your back against the pad and feet flat on the floor.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
Step:4 Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, open your arms out to the sides in a controlled motion.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the fully extended position, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: kettlebell hang clean
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in front of your thighs.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Lower the kettlebell towards the ground, allowing it to swing between your legs.
Step:4 Quickly extend your hips and knees, using the momentum to swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height.
Step:5 As the kettlebell reaches shoulder height, rotate your wrists and catch the kettlebell in the rack position, with your elbow tucked in and the kettlebell resting on your forearm.
Step:6 Lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position between your legs, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell rear fly
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Extend your arms straight down towards the ground, palms facing each other.
Step:4 Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, lift your arms out to the sides and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing preacher curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
Step:2 Rest the back of your upper arms against the preacher bench or an incline bench, with your elbows slightly bent.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: olympic barbell triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding the barbell with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Raise the barbell above your head, fully extending your arms.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms close to your head, slowly lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable seated overhead curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench facing the cable machine with your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Grasp the cable attachment with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Keep your upper arms stationary and your elbows close to your sides.
Step:4 Exhale and curl the cable attachment towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly lower the cable attachment back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever back extension
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the machine to fit your body size and range of motion.
Step:2 Sit on the machine with your back against the pad and your feet secured.
Step:3 Place your hands on the handles or grip bars.
Step:4 Engage your core and slowly lean forward, allowing your back to round slightly.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom position, feeling a stretch in your lower back.
Step:6 Using your back muscles, slowly raise your torso back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith reverse grip bent over row
instructions: Step:1 Set up the smith machine with the bar at hip height.
Step:2 Stand facing the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:5 Pull the bar towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell one arm prone curl
instructions: Step:1 Lie face down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand, palm facing down.
Step:2 Extend your arm fully, letting it hang straight down towards the floor.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arm stationary, curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder by contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

name: smith one arm row
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the height of the smith machine bar to waist level.
Step:2 Stand facing the smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:4 Grasp the bar with one hand using an overhand grip, with your palm facing down.
Step:5 Keep your elbow close to your body and pull the bar towards your waist, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

name: dumbbell front raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your thighs.
Step:2 Keeping your arms straight, exhale and lift the dumbbells in front of you until they are at shoulder level.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell standing leg calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a barbell across your back.
Step:2 Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using your calves.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable standing cross-over high reverse fly
instructions: Step:1 Attach a D-handle to each side of a cable machine at shoulder height.
Step:2 Stand in the middle of the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms out to the sides, palms facing forward.
Step:4 Keep a slight bend in your elbows and maintain a straight back throughout the exercise.
Step:5 Engage your shoulder muscles and squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull the handles towards the front of your body.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: gironda sternum chin
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing a high bar with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Reach up and grab the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:4 Engage your back and biceps to pull your chest up towards the bar, leading with your sternum.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: inverted row v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Set up a bar at waist height on a Smith machine or use a suspension trainer.
Step:2 Stand facing the bar or suspension trainer and grab it with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Walk your feet forward, leaning back until your body is at a slight angle.
Step:4 Keep your body straight and pull your chest up towards the bar or handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith front squat (clean grip)
instructions: Step:1 Set up the smith machine with the barbell at shoulder height.
Step:2 Stand facing the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Step back and position the barbell on your front shoulders, resting it on your collarbone and deltoids.
Step:5 Keep your chest up, back straight, and core engaged.
Step:6 Lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, as if sitting back into a chair.
Step:7 Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
Step:8 Pause for a moment, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:9 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing overhead press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with your palms facing forward.
Step:2 Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder level.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable rear pulldown
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the cable machine so that the pulley is at the highest position.
Step:2 Sit facing the machine with your feet flat on the ground and your knees slightly bent.
Step:3 Grasp the cable attachment with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
Step:5 Pull the cable attachment down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the cable back up to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell one arm hammer press on exercise ball
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing inwards and your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:3 Place your other hand on your hip for stability.
Step:4 Press the dumbbell upwards, extending your arm fully.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

name: dumbbell standing around world
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height, palms facing down.
Step:3 Keeping your arms straight, slowly rotate your arms in a circular motion, bringing the dumbbells in front of your body and then overhead.
Step:4 Continue the circular motion, bringing the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever t bar row
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and footplate position to ensure proper alignment.
Step:2 Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the footplate.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Step:5 Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the peak contraction, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: modified push up to lower arms
instructions: Step:1 Start in a push-up position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your body down towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:3 Once your elbows are at a 90-degree angle, lower your forearms to the ground, keeping your elbows directly under your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then push through your palms to lift your forearms back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: sled hack squat
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the sled machine to a comfortable position for your height.
Step:2 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform, toes slightly pointed outwards.
Step:3 Hold onto the handles or bars for stability.
Step:4 Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Step:5 Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground or slightly below.
Step:6 Pause for a moment, then push through your heels to raise your body back up to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight up overhead.
Step:3 Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your upper arms close to your ears.
Step:4 Pause for a moment, then straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Set up the smith machine with the bar at hip height.
Step:2 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
Step:3 Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight and chest up, and grip the bar with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Engage your core and lift the bar by extending your hips and knees, keeping the bar close to your body.
Step:5 Stand up straight, fully extending your hips and knees.
Step:6 Lower the bar back down by bending at the hips and knees, maintaining control and keeping your back straight.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell palm rotational bent over row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:3 Let your arms hang straight down, palms facing your body.
Step:4 Engage your core and pull the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:5 As you pull the dumbbells up, rotate your palms so they face away from your body.
Step:6 Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
Step:7 Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, rotating your palms back to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing triceps extension
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Step:2 Raise the dumbbell overhead, keeping your arm straight.
Step:3 Bend your elbow and lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your upper arm stationary.
Step:4 Extend your arm back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable drag curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing a cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Grasp the cable attachment with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the cable attachment towards your shoulders by contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the cable attachment back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band twisting overhead press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band under your feet.
Step:2 Hold the band handles at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
Step:3 Engage your core and press the band overhead, fully extending your arms.
Step:4 As you press, twist your torso to one side, keeping your hips stable.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat the press and twist on the opposite side.
Step:7 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable standing crunch
instructions: Step:1 Attach a cable handle to a high pulley and stand facing away from the machine.
Step:2 Hold the handle with both hands and place it behind your head, keeping your elbows bent.
Step:3 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:4 Keeping your abs engaged, exhale and crunch your torso down towards your knees, bringing your elbows towards your thighs.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell rear lateral raise (support head)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step:3 Raise your arms out to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, until they are parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: exercise ball one legged diagonal kick hamstring curl
instructions: Step:1 Start by lying on your back with your legs extended and your heels resting on top of the stability ball.
Step:2 Place your arms by your sides for stability.
Step:3 Engage your glutes and core muscles to lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from your shoulders to your heels.
Step:4 Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest, keeping your left leg extended and your foot flexed.
Step:5 Kick your right leg diagonally across your body, extending it fully and engaging your hamstrings.
Step:6 Slowly return your right leg to the starting position, maintaining control and stability.
Step:7 Repeat the movement with your left leg, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable incline pushdown
instructions: Step:1 Attach a straight bar to a high pulley cable machine.
Step:2 Stand facing away from the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Lean forward slightly and keep your back straight.
Step:5 Pull the bar down towards your thighs by extending your elbows.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: shoulder grip pull-up
instructions: Step:1 Grab the pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip, palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Hang freely with your arms fully extended.
Step:3 Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar until your chin is above the bar.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: incline scapula push up
instructions: Step:1 Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step:2 Place your hands on the bench slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Position your feet on the ground, hip-width apart.
Step:4 Lower your chest towards the bench, keeping your elbows tucked in.
Step:5 As you lower, retract your shoulder blades, squeezing your scapulae together.
Step:6 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable two arm curl on incline bench
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an incline bench with your back against the pad and your feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Grasp the cable handles with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and your arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the handles towards your shoulders while contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the handles back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hanging straight leg raise
instructions: Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step:2 Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you, keeping them straight.
Step:3 Continue lifting until your legs are parallel to the ground or as high as you can comfortably go.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: assisted sit-up
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench or have someone hold your feet down.
Step:2 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:3 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:4 Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell standing wide-grip curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Let the barbell hang at arm's length in front of your thighs, with your palms facing away from your body.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell upward by contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: battling ropes
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hold one end of the rope in each hand, with your palms facing each other.
Step:3 Raise your arms to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
Step:4 Begin making alternating waves with the ropes by rapidly raising and lowering each arm.
Step:5 Continue for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell hammer curl on exercise ball
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body and your arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the dumbbells while contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell rear lunge v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell across your back.
Step:2 Take a step backward with your right foot, landing on the ball of your foot.
Step:3 Bend both knees to lower your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground.
Step:4 Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with the other leg.

name: lever reverse t-bar row
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and footplate position on the leverage machine.
Step:2 Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the footplate.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Step:5 Pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release and extend your arms back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: kettlebell double push press
instructions: Step:1 Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and engage your core.
Step:3 Initiate the movement by explosively extending your hips, knees, and ankles, driving the kettlebells overhead.
Step:4 As the kettlebells reach the top, press them fully overhead, locking out your arms.
Step:5 Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position by bending your elbows and bringing them back down to shoulder height.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: reclining big toe pose with rope
instructions: Step:1 Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Loop the rope around the ball of your right foot and hold the ends of the rope with your hands.
Step:3 Slowly raise your right leg towards your chest, keeping your knee straight and your foot flexed.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with your left leg.
Step:6 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: mixed grip chin-up
instructions: Step:1 Grab the pull-up bar with an underhand grip (palms facing towards you) and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
Step:3 Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, leading with your chest.
Step:4 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position with control.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: deep push up
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
Step:3 Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: crab twist toe touch
instructions: Step:1 Start by sitting on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Step:2 Place your hands behind you, fingers pointing towards your feet, and lift your hips off the ground.
Step:3 Extend one leg straight out in front of you while simultaneously reaching your opposite hand towards your toes.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: jump squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:3 Jump explosively off the ground, extending your hips, knees, and ankles.
Step:4 While in mid-air, quickly bring your arms forward for balance.
Step:5 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately go into the next repetition.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell upright row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Let the dumbbells hang in front of your thighs, with your arms fully extended.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, exhale and lift the dumbbells straight up towards your chin, leading with your elbows.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable one arm preacher curl
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the cable machine so that the preacher curl pad is at chest height.
Step:2 Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grasp the cable handle with an underhand grip and position your upper arm against the preacher curl pad.
Step:4 Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:5 Slowly curl the cable handle towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm against the pad.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step:7 Slowly lower the cable handle back to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Step:9 Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: kettlebell double jerk
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
Step:2 Bend your knees slightly and engage your core.
Step:3 Press the kettlebells overhead, fully extending your arms.
Step:4 Bend your knees and quickly drop into a partial squat.
Step:5 Explosively extend your hips and knees, driving the kettlebells overhead.
Step:6 Lock out your arms and catch the kettlebells overhead with your knees slightly bent.
Step:7 Stand up straight and return to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell step-up
instructions: Step:1 Stand in front of a bench or step with a barbell resting on your back.
Step:2 Place one foot on the bench or step, ensuring your entire foot is in contact with the surface.
Step:3 Push through your heel and step up onto the bench or step, fully extending your hip and knee.
Step:4 Pause briefly at the top, then lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with the opposite leg.
Step:6 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band front lateral raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band in front of your thighs with your palms facing down.
Step:2 Keep your arms straight and lift the band up in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the band back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: butterfly yoga pose
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you.
Step:2 Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together, allowing your knees to fall out to the sides.
Step:3 Hold onto your ankles or feet with your hands.
Step:4 Sit up tall and lengthen your back.
Step:5 Gently press your knees down towards the floor, feeling a stretch in your inner thighs.
Step:6 Hold this position for a few breaths.
Step:7 To release, slowly bring your knees back up and extend your legs.

name: two toe touch (male)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides.
Step:2 Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step:3 Reach down towards your toes with both hands, keeping your legs straight.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable lateral pulldown (with rope attachment)
instructions: Step:1 Attach a rope attachment to the cable machine at a high position.
Step:2 Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Grasp the rope with an overhand grip, palms facing each other.
Step:4 Keep your back straight and lean slightly back.
Step:5 Pull the rope down towards your sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement.
Step:7 Slowly release the tension and allow the rope to return to the starting position.
Step:8 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell incline curl v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward and arms fully extended.
Step:2 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hands bike
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and handlebar position to a comfortable level.
Step:2 Sit on the ergometer with your back straight and feet on the pedals.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with your hands and position your arms at a 90-degree angle.
Step:4 Start pedaling with your hands, pushing and pulling the handles in a controlled motion.
Step:5 Continue pedaling for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

name: lever high row
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and foot platform to a comfortable position.
Step:2 Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the foot platform.
Step:3 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:4 Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Step:5 Pull the handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: knee touch crunch
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, lift your shoulder blades off the ground and reach your right hand towards your left knee.
Step:4 Return to the starting position and repeat, this time reaching your left hand towards your right knee.
Step:5 Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: drop push up
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:3 Once your chest is just above the ground, quickly drop your knees to the ground.
Step:4 Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell guillotine bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Lower the barbell slowly towards your neck, keeping your elbows pointed outwards.
Step:4 Pause for a moment when the barbell is just above your neck.
Step:5 Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell one arm standing hammer curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso.
Step:2 Keep your elbows close to your torso and your upper arms stationary.
Step:3 Exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:4 Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step:5 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:6 Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell romanian deadlift
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge at the hips and lower the dumbbells towards the ground, allowing your knees to bend slightly.
Step:3 Lower the dumbbells until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, then push through your heels and engage your glutes to return to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable seated high row (v-bar)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the cable machine with your feet flat on the floor and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Grasp the v-bar attachment with an overhand grip, palms facing each other, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Keep your back straight and lean slightly forward from the hips.
Step:4 Pull the v-bar towards your torso by retracting your shoulder blades and squeezing your back muscles.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the peak of the contraction, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing alternate raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Raise one dumbbell to the side, keeping your arm straight and your palm facing down.
Step:4 Continue lifting until your arm is parallel to the ground.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat with the other arm.
Step:7 Alternate between arms for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lying alternate extension
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
Step:2 Extend your arms straight up over your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
Step:3 Lower one dumbbell down towards your head, bending at the elbow, while keeping the other arm extended.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat with the other arm, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted standing curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
Step:2 Keep your elbows close to your torso and exhale as you curl the weights up to shoulder level.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale as you slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell arnold press v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with back support and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level, palms facing your body and elbows bent.
Step:2 Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended and your palms are facing forward.
Step:3 Rotate your wrists as you lift, so that your palms end up facing forward at the top of the movement.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable side crunch
instructions: Step:1 Attach a cable handle to a low pulley and stand sideways to the machine.
Step:2 Grasp the handle with the hand furthest from the machine and place your other hand on your hip.
Step:3 Keep your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:4 With your abs engaged, bend sideways at the waist, bringing your elbow down towards your hip.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: stability ball crunch (full range hands behind head)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:2 Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step:3 Engaging your abs, slowly curl your upper body forward, bringing your chest towards your knees.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell shrug
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in front of you with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Keep your arms straight and your back straight throughout the exercise.
Step:3 Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible, squeezing your traps at the top.
Step:4 Hold for a moment, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever shrug
instructions: Step:1 Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the leverage machine with your back against the pad.
Step:2 Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and keep your arms straight.
Step:3 Keeping your back straight, lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as possible.
Step:4 Hold the contraction for a moment, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: clock push-up
instructions: Step:1 Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line.
Step:2 Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your sides.
Step:3 As you lower, rotate your body to the left, extending your left arm straight out to the side.
Step:4 Push back up to the starting position, while rotating your body to the center.
Step:5 Repeat the push-up, this time rotating your body to the right and extending your right arm out to the side.
Step:6 Continue alternating sides with each repetition.

name: dumbbell shrug
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
Step:2 Keep your arms straight and let the dumbbells hang by your sides.
Step:3 Raise your shoulders as high as possible, as if you are trying to touch your ears with your shoulders.
Step:4 Hold the contraction for a second, then slowly lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band bench press
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
Step:2 Grasp the band handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Extend your arms fully, pushing the bands away from your chest.
Step:4 Slowly lower the bands back down to your chest, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable lateral raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the cable handles with an overhand grip.
Step:2 Keep your arms straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable forward raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step:2 Hold the cable handle with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and your arms fully extended in front of you.
Step:3 Keeping your arms straight, raise the cable handle up to shoulder level.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the cable handle back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing palms in press
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with your palms facing inwards.
Step:2 Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, press the dumbbells upwards until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: exercise ball lat stretch
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in one hand and extend your arm straight up overhead.
Step:3 Slowly lean to the opposite side, feeling a stretch in your lat muscle.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side.

name: lower back curl
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your stomach with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
Step:2 Engage your glutes and hamstrings, and slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling your back upwards.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: triceps dip (bench leg)
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands gripping the edge, fingers pointing forward.
Step:2 Walk your feet forward, sliding your butt off the bench, and straighten your arms.
Step:3 Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench.
Step:4 Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: medicine ball supine chest throw
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back on a bench with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step:2 Hold the medicine ball with both hands, extending your arms straight up above your chest.
Step:3 Lower the medicine ball towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step:4 Explosively push the medicine ball upwards, extending your arms fully and throwing the ball as high as possible.
Step:5 Catch the medicine ball and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band bent-over hip extension
instructions: Step:1 Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at ankle height.
Step:2 Stand facing away from the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Step back to create tension in the band, keeping your knees slightly bent.
Step:4 Hinge at the hips and lean forward, maintaining a neutral back.
Step:5 Extend your right leg straight back, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Step:6 Lower your right leg back down and repeat with the left leg.
Step:7 Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: biceps pull-up
instructions: Step:1 Hang from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Engage your core and pull yourself up by bending your elbows, bringing your chest towards the bar.
Step:3 Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: potty squat with support
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outward.
Step:2 Hold onto a stable support, such as a chair or wall, for balance.
Step:3 Lower your body down into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
Step:4 Keep your chest up and your back straight throughout the movement.
Step:5 Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable standing calf raise
instructions: Step:1 Stand facing a cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Hold onto the cable machine handles or attach a cable ankle strap to your ankles.
Step:3 Raise your heels off the ground by extending your ankles as high as possible.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell alternate biceps curl
instructions: Step:1 Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
Step:2 Keep your upper arms stationary and exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step:3 Continue to raise the barbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbells are at shoulder level.
Step:4 Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale as you slowly begin to lower the barbells back to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating arms.

name: bodyweight standing close-grip one arm row
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold a dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip.
Step:2 Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step:3 Pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: forward jump
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position.
Step:3 Swing your arms back for momentum.
Step:4 Jump forward explosively, extending your hips, knees, and ankles.
Step:5 Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately go into the next jump.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable floor seated wide-grip row
instructions: Step:1 Sit on the floor with your legs extended and your back straight.
Step:2 Attach a cable handle to a low pulley and position the cable machine behind you.
Step:3 Grasp the handle with a wide overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step:4 Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and your chest lifted.
Step:5 Pull the handle towards your waist, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step:6 Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release the handle back to the starting position.
Step:7 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: resistance band leg extension
instructions: Step:1 Attach the resistance band to a sturdy anchor point and secure it around your ankle.
Step:2 Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Keeping your core engaged and your upper body stable, extend your leg straight out in front of you.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly return your leg to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

name: one leg squat
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend one leg forward, keeping it off the ground.
Step:3 Bend your standing leg and lower your body down as if sitting back into a chair.
Step:4 Keep your chest up and your back straight.
Step:5 Push through your heel to return to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat with the other leg.

name: dumbbell one arm press on exercise ball
instructions: Step:1 Sit on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step:2 Hold a dumbbell in one hand and position it at shoulder height, with your elbow bent and palm facing forward.
Step:3 Slowly press the dumbbell upward until your arm is fully extended, while keeping your core engaged and maintaining balance on the exercise ball.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

name: burpee
instructions: Step:1 Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and placing your hands on the floor in front of you.
Step:3 Kick your feet back into a push-up position.
Step:4 Perform a push-up, keeping your body in a straight line.
Step:5 Jump your feet back into the squat position.
Step:6 Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead.
Step:7 Land softly and immediately lower back into a squat position to begin the next repetition.

name: scissor jumps (male)
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Jump off the ground and simultaneously cross your right leg in front of your left leg.
Step:3 As you land, quickly switch legs, crossing your left leg in front of your right leg.
Step:4 Continue alternating legs and jumping as quickly as possible.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated one arm rotate
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a bench with your back straight and hold a dumbbell in one hand, resting it on your thigh.
Step:2 Raise the dumbbell up to shoulder height, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Step:3 Rotate your forearm outward, away from your body, while keeping your upper arm stationary.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly rotate your forearm back to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

name: rear deltoid stretch
instructions: Step:1 Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Extend your right arm across your chest, placing your left hand on your right elbow.
Step:3 Gently pull your right arm towards your left shoulder, feeling a stretch in your right shoulder.
Step:4 Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release.
Step:5 Repeat on the other side.

name: upward facing dog
instructions: Step:1 Lie face down on the floor with your legs extended behind you.
Step:2 Place your hands on the floor next to your lower ribs, fingers pointing forward.
Step:3 Press your hands firmly into the floor and straighten your arms, lifting your torso and thighs off the ground.
Step:4 Roll your shoulders back and down, opening your chest and lifting your gaze towards the ceiling.
Step:5 Hold this position for a few breaths, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell front raise v. 2
instructions: Step:1 Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your thighs.
Step:2 Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Step:3 Slowly lift the dumbbells in front of you, with your arms straight, until they are at shoulder level.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step:5 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted close grip chin-up on dip cage
instructions: Step:1 Stand in front of the dip cage and grab the parallel bars with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step:2 Hang from the bars with your arms fully extended, feet off the ground, and body straight.
Step:3 Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bars, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step:4 Continue pulling until your chin is above the bars, then pause for a moment.
Step:5 Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted straight bar dip
instructions: Step:1 Position yourself between parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step:2 Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step:3 Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band jack knife sit-up
instructions: Step:1 Lie flat on your back with your legs straight and your arms extended overhead, holding the band.
Step:2 Engage your abs and lift your legs and upper body simultaneously, bringing your hands towards your feet.
Step:3 Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs and upper body back down to the starting position.
Step:4 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell preacher curl
instructions: Step:1 Sit on a preacher bench with your upper arms resting on the pad and your chest against the support.
Step:2 Grasp the barbell with an underhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step:3 Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders.
Step:4 Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step:5 Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step:6 Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable seated one arm concentration curl
